required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Liposomal Bupivacaine Compared to Usual Care and Its Effects on Pain for Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Liposomal Bupivacaine Compared to Usual Care and Its Effects on Pain for Cardiac Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of Liposomal Bupivacaine Compared to Usual Care and its Effect on Pain for Cardiac Surgery

detailed_description.textblock:
Current standard of care for pain management includes a multimodal approach of peristernal and fifth intercoastal infiltration with 0.25% bupivacaine with epinepherine combined with immediate post operative IV acetaminophen, followed by scheduled oral acetaminophen and supplemental IV and PO narcotics. This practice is beneficial since it controls most of the direct surgical site pain for at least 6 hours, however, after the local anesthetic dissipates, pain is usually managed with the use of opioids combined with scheduled oral acetaminophen.
Opioids are the most commonly used medications to control pain early after surgery because of their high potency. However, their undesirable effects and risk of dependence become limitations.
The Investigators believe Liposomal Bupivacaine would be beneficial in this population due to its quick onset of action and prolonged half-life associated with liposomal formulation ranging from 23.8 to 34.1 hours. The primary endpoint will be a 20% reduction in opioids use.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Study comparing current standard of therapy using 0.25% bupivacaine with epinepherine at 1cc/kg total dose and the addition of liposomal bupivacaine 266mg/20ml for pain management in cardiac surgery. Patient and Investigator are blinded.
study_design_info.masking_description: Patients will be randomized per study coordinator. SOC includes 0.25%bupivacaine with epinephrine at 1cc/kg total dose and the treatment arm will include liposomal bupivacaine 266mg/20ml added to usual dose.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From post operative day of cardiac surgery through length of hospital admission and through study completion, an average of one year.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post operative day of surgery through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Record in 15 minutes intervals the time when the breathing tube is removed

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post operative day of surgery through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Record time in 15 minute intervals the length of time in ICU

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Scores on Post op day 2,3 and 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post operative day of cardiac surgery through Post operative Day 4
secondary_outcome.description: Record pain scores using the Wong - Baker" FACES" Pain rating scale and /or CPOT Critical Care Pain Observation Tool. Collecting the Scale ratings of 4-10.*Face #4 Hurts a Little, Face#6 Hurts Even More, Face #8 Hurts a Whole Lot Face#10 Hurts Worst. CPOT- Critical Care Pain Observational Tool Documenting Pain Intensity, Pain Location, Pain Radiation and Pain Description.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total narcotic use on Post op Day 2,3, and 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day of cardiac surgery to Post op day 4
secondary_outcome.description: Record daily narcotic use both Oral and Intravenous administration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Count the number of days from admission for cardiac surgery to day of hospital discharge through study completion , an average of one year
secondary_outcome.description: Record the number of days(LOS) length of stay in the hospital from post operative surgery to discharge

secondary_outcome.measure: Major Adverse Cardiac Effects of Liposomal Bupivacaine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of peristernal and fifth intercostal infiltration of liposomal bupivacaine through the expected half life associated with liposomal formulation ranging from 23.8 up to 34.1 hours.
secondary_outcome.description: Record Major Adverse Cardiac Effects associated with Liposomal Bupivacaine, Arrythmias, Hypotension > 90/50,AV Block and Cardiac Arrest

arm_group.description: administration of liposomal bupivacaine 266mg/20mL+ 40 mL bupivacaine 0.25% bupivacaine .
administration of 0.25% bupivacaine with epinephrine at 1cc/kg total dose

intervention.description: 20mL EXPAREL+40mL bupivacaine 0.25% infiltrated into 5th intercostal space
0.25% Bupivacaine with epinephrine at 1cc/kg total dose infiltrated into 5th intercostal space

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age >18 years old
- All open heart surgeries from September 1, 2019 - September 30, 2020
- Able to read, comprehend and sign the informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- < 18 years old and prisoners
- Not able to sign informed consent, including patients with an (LAR) legally authorized representative
- Patients with chronic pain requiring scheduled narcotic use
- Stage 4 kidney disease, Child Pugh score suggestive of liver cirrhosis/ disease
- Recent MI within 7 days of scheduled Cardiac surgery
- Known allergy to Liposomal Bupivacaine or derivative of
- Have or is currently involved in a Research Study within 30 days of scheduled surgery

overall_official.affiliation: Florida Heart and Lung Institute, HCA Physician Services
